causality.effect: Initiates analog-to-digital conversion and forces SDO to a high-impedance state.
SDO transitions from high-impedance to a low state, signaling that conversion data is ready to be read.
The next data bit (MSB first, from D15 to D0) is clocked out on the SDO line.
causality.condition: During the data readback phase (Clocks 1 through 16).

causality.effect: SDO returns to a high-impedance state.
causality.condition: This is an optional clock pulse to disable the SDO driver.

constraints.tCYC: Cycle Time: Minimum time between consecutive rising edges of CNV.
constraints.tCONV: Conversion Time: The duration from the rising edge of CNV until the conversion is complete.
constraints.tACQ: Acquisition Time: The period after a conversion and readback during which the device acquires the next analog signal before a new conversion can start.
constraints.tSSDICNV: SDI Setup Time: The minimum time SDI must be stable high before the rising edge of CNV.
constraints.tHSDICNV: SDI Hold Time: The minimum time SDI must remain stable high after the rising edge of CNV.
constraints.tEN: SDO Enable Time: The time from SDO going low (end of conversion) to the first valid data bit (D15) being available. This defines the minimum wait time before starting SCK.
constraints.tSCK: SCK Period: The duration of one SCK clock cycle.
constraints.tSCKL: SCK Low Time: The minimum duration the SCK signal must be low.
constraints.tSCKH: SCK High Time: The minimum duration the SCK signal must be high.
constraints.tHSDO: SDO Hold Time: The duration for which the SDO data remains valid after the falling edge of SCK.
constraints.tDSDO: SDO Data Delay: The propagation delay from the falling edge of SCK until the next data bit is valid on SDO.
constraints.tDIS: SDO Disable Time: The time it takes for the SDO line to enter a high-impedance state after the 17th falling edge of SCK.

states.name: Acquisition
states.description: The device is ready to sample the analog input. This state precedes the conversion and follows the completion of the previous data readback.

states.name: Conversion
states.description: Initiated by a rising edge on CNV. The ADC is busy performing the conversion. During this state, the SDO output is in a high-impedance state.

states.name: Data Readback
states.description: This state begins after the conversion is complete, indicated by SDO going low. The digital host provides 16 SCK pulses to read the conversion result from the SDO pin.

states.name: High-Z (SDO)
states.description: The SDO output driver is tri-stated (high-impedance). This occurs during the 'Conversion' state and after the full data word has been clocked out.
